Water plants thoroughly according to their needs
Record water amount used and method applied

Water early morning or late evening to reduce evaporation
Deep, infrequent watering is better than frequent shallow watering
Adjust watering based on weather conditions and plant needs
Document soil condition before and after for tracking

tips: Wear gloves for safety and hygiene
Take before/after comparison photos
Sort items for proper recycling when possible
Work in teams for larger areas and safety

materials: Plants (trees, seedlings, shrubs, or other vegetation)

Research proper depth and spacing for your specific plant

Label plants or keep records for future reference

steps: Assess harvest readiness and optimal timing
Gather harvesting tools and containers
Photograph the crops before harvesting
Harvest carefully to avoid damage to plants and produce
Record quantity, quality, and any observations

tips: Harvest at optimal time of day (usually morning for best quality)
Handle produce carefully to avoid bruising
Track harvest yield over time for planning future crops
Document any pest or disease issues for garden records
Clean and store produce properly to maintain freshness
